definition:
A *partition* $P$ of a set $S$ is a collection of pairwise disjoint
nonempty sets such that $\cup P = S$.

Any partition $P$ of a set $S$ introduces an equivalence relation on
$S$, where each $A \in P$ is an equivalence class. Similarly, given an
equivalence relation on $S$, the collection of distinct equivalence
classes is a partition of $S$.
